page.title: 19OLD BUILDINGS IN THE AREA
page.content: {Boconnoc House}was built many hundreds of years ago and over the years many additions and alterations have been made. The house is no longer inhabited although the present owner lives on the Estate. {Ethy House}was until recently the most important home in{Lerryn}and the landowner resided there. The house is still occupied but the land is now owned by the{National {Trust.}The{old granary, mill, boat {house}and{blacksmith's}are now homes. {Lime kilns}can still be seen in {Lerryn.}One is now a ruin, but the other has been converted into a dwelling. The oldest house in Lerryn is {Yonder Cott}which is over 400 years old. The{old bridge}was built in 1600,prior to that there was a ford.
